content.en: Tremor analysis: Researchers have been exploring the use of various algorithms to study and characterize tremors, which are associated with neurological disorders. These algorithms, such as empirical mode decomposition and Hilbert spectrum, can automatically decompose tremor signals and provide insights into the nature of these disorders. Additionally, adaptive algorithms like the adaptive band-pass filter and the iterated Hilbert transform have shown promise in estimating tremor from sensor data and EMG signals, respectively. These advancements in algorithmic analysis offer potential for real-time tremor characterization and filtering, as well as predicting the onset of pathological tremors.
content.da: Tremoranalyse: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af forskellige algoritmer til at studere og karakterisere tremor, som er forbundet med neurologiske lidelser. Disse algoritmer, såsom empirisk mode decomposition og Hilbert spektrum, kan automatisk dekomponere tremorsignaler og give indsigt i naturen af disse lidelser. Derudover har adaptive algoritmer som den adaptive båndpasfilter og den itererede Hilbert-transform vist lovende resultater i at estimere tremor fra sensordata og EMG-signaler, henholdsvis. Disse fremskridt inden for algoritmisk analyse tilbyder potentiale for realtids karakterisering og filtrering af tremor samt forudsigelse af patologiske tremorers begyndelse.
